title: Contributing to SPARQLchunks
text: outlines propose change SPARQLchunks. detailed discussion contributing tidyverse packages, please see development contributing guide code review principles.

title: Contributing to SPARQLchunks
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to SPARQLchunks
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed). See guide create great issue advice.

title: Contributing to SPARQLchunks
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("aourednik/SPARQLchunks", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to SPARQLchunks
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to SPARQLchunks
text: Please note SPARQLchunks project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: SPARQL chunks and queries
text: use full potential package need load library tell knitr SPARQL engine exists: done , can run SPARQL chunks:

title: SPARQL chunks and queries
text: output.var: name data.frame want store results endpoint: URL SPARQL endpoint autoproxy: whether try use automatic proxy detection Example 1 (Swiss administration endpoint) Example 2 (Uniprot endpoint) Note use attempt automatic proxy detection. Example 3 (WikiData endpoint):
code: ```{sparql output.var="queryres_csv", endpoint="https://lindas.admin.ch/query"} PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/> SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . } ``` ```{sparql output.var="tes5", endpoint="https://sparql.uniprot.org/sparql", autoproxy=TRUE} PREFIX up: <http://purl.uniprot.org/core/> SELECT ?taxon FROM <http://sparql.uniprot.org/taxonomy> WHERE {     ?taxon a up:Taxon . } LIMIT 500 ``` ```{sparql output.var="res.df", endpoint="https://query.wikidata.org/sparql"} SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?country ?countryLabel ?linkTo ?linkToLabel WHERE {     ?item wdt:P1142 ?linkTo .     ?linkTo wdt:P31 wd:Q12909644 .     VALUES ?type { wd:Q7278  wd:Q24649 }     ?item wdt:P31 ?type .     ?item wdt:P17 ?country .     MINUS { ?item wdt:P576 ?abolitionDate }     SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" . } } ```

title: SPARQL chunks and queries
text: output.var: name list want store results endpoint: URL SPARQL endpoint output.type : set “list”, retrieves list (tree structure) instead dataframe autoproxy: whether try use automatic proxy detection
code: ```{sparql output.var="queryres_list", endpoint="https://lindas.admin.ch/query", output.type="list"} PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/> SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . } ```

title: SPARQL chunks and queries
text: inline functions sparql2df sparql2list pair arguments: SPARQL endpoint SPARQL query. Queries can multi-line:
code: endpoint <- "https://lindas.admin.ch/query" query <- "PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>   SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . }"

title: SPARQL chunks and queries
text: attempt automatic proxy detection:
code: result_df <- sparql2df(endpoint,query) result_df <- sparql2df(endpoint,query,autoproxy=TRUE)

title: SPARQL chunks and queries
text: attempt automatic proxy detection:
code: result_list <- sparql2list(endpoint,query) result_list <- sparql2list(endpoint,query,autoproxy=TRUE)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Andre Ourednik. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ourednik (2025). SPARQLChunks: Query SPARQL endpoints run SPARQL chunks R-markdown files. R package version 0.3, https://github.com/aourednik/SPARQLchunks.
code: @Manual{sparqlchunks,   title = {SPARQLChunks: Query SPARQL endpoints and run SPARQL chunks in R-markdown files},   author = {André Ourednik},   note = {R package version 0.3},   year = {2025},   url = {https://github.com/aourednik/SPARQLchunks}, }

what: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: Coding R useless without interesting research questions; even best questions remain unanswered without data. RStudio provides number convenient ways access data, among possibility write SQL code chunks Rmarkdown, run chunks assign value query result directly variable choice. thing available yet SPARQL queries: ones allow navigate gigantic knowledge graphs incarnate conscience semantic web. SPARQLchunks package steps . package allows query SPARQL endpoints two different ways: allows run SPARQL chunks Rmarkdown files. provides inline functions send SPARQL queries user-defined endpoint retrieve data dataframe form (sparql2df) list form (sparql2list). Endpoints can reached behind corporate firewalls Windows machines thanks automatic proxy detection. See Execute SPARQL chunks R Markdown.

title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: users can install running command behind corporate firewall Windows machine, direct access GitHub might blocked. case, run installation code instead:
code: remotes::install_github("aourednik/SPARQLchunks", build_vignettes = TRUE) proxy_url <- curl::ie_get_proxy_for_url("https://github.com") httr::set_config(httr::use_proxy(proxy_url)) remotes::install_url("https://github.com/aourednik/SPARQLchunks/archive/refs/heads/main.zip", build_vignettes = TRUE)

title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: use full potential package need load library tell knitr SPARQL engine exists: {r setup, include=FALSE} library(SPARQLchunks) knitr::knit_engines$set(sparql = SPARQLchunks::eng_sparql) done , can run SPARQL chunks:

title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: output.var: name data frame want store results endpoint: URL SPARQL endpoint autoproxy: whether try use automatic proxy detection auth: authentication information sparql endpoint (httr authentication object, optional) Example 1 (Swiss administration endpoint) Example 2 (Uniprot endpoint) Note use attempt automatic proxy detection. Example 3 (WikiData endpoint):
code: ```{sparql output.var="queryres_df", endpoint="https://lindas.admin.ch/query"} PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/> SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . } ``` ```{sparql output.var="tes5", endpoint="https://sparql.uniprot.org/sparql", autoproxy=TRUE} PREFIX up: <http://purl.uniprot.org/core/> SELECT ?taxon FROM <http://sparql.uniprot.org/taxonomy> WHERE {     ?taxon a up:Taxon . } LIMIT 500 ``` ```{sparql output.var="res.df", endpoint="https://query.wikidata.org/sparql"} SELECT DISTINCT ?item ?itemLabel ?country ?countryLabel ?linkTo ?linkToLabel WHERE {     ?item wdt:P1142 ?linkTo .     ?linkTo wdt:P31 wd:Q12909644 .     VALUES ?type { wd:Q7278  wd:Q24649 }     ?item wdt:P31 ?type .     ?item wdt:P17 ?country .     MINUS { ?item wdt:P576 ?abolitionDate }     SERVICE wikibase:label { bd:serviceParam wikibase:language "[AUTO_LANGUAGE],en" . } } ```

title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: output.var: name list want store results endpoint: URL SPARQL endpoint output.type : set “list”, retrieves list (tree structure) instead data-frame autoproxy: whether try use automatic proxy detection
code: ```{sparql output.var="queryres_list", endpoint="https://lindas.admin.ch/query", output.type="list"} PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/> SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . } ```

title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: inline functions sparql2df sparql2list pair arguments: SPARQL endpoint SPARQL query. Queries can multi-line:
code: endpoint <- "https://lindas.admin.ch/query" query <- "PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>   SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . }"

title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: attempt automatic proxy detection:
code: result_df <- sparql2df(endpoint,query) result_df <- sparql2df(endpoint,query,autoproxy=TRUE)

title: Run SPARQL Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data
text: attempt automatic proxy detection:
code: result_list <- sparql2list(endpoint,query) result_list <- sparql2list(endpoint,query,autoproxy=TRUE)

what: SPARQLchunks: Run 'SPARQL' Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data — SPARQLchunks-package
title: SPARQLchunks: Run 'SPARQL' Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data — SPARQLchunks-package
text: Allows run 'SPARQL' chunks R-markdown files. Also provides inline functions send 'SPARQL' query endpoint retrieve data data frame list form.

title: SPARQLchunks: Run 'SPARQL' Chunks and Inline Functions to Retrieve Data — SPARQLchunks-package
text: Maintainer: Andre Ourednik andre.ourednik@epfl.ch (ORCID)

what: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
text: Pointing knitr function alows run SPARQL chunks R Markdown: knitr::knit_engines$set(sparql = SPARQLchunks::eng_sparql). Usage internal.

title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
code: eng_sparql(opts)

title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
text: opts Chunk options, provided knitr chunk execution. Chunk option sparql. Note avoid calling "options" avoid conflict R system function name.

title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
text: Data dataframe list form (depending opts). function returns output.var store result defined.

title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
text: sparql engine can activated via   set within R Markdown document's setup chunk. use eng_sparql function elsewhere.
code: knitr::knit_engines$set(sparql = SPARQLchunks::eng_sparql)

title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
text: André Ourednik (2021). Execute SPARQL chunks Rmarkdown Available :  https://ourednik.info/maps/2021/12/14/execute-sparql-chunks--r-markdown/

title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
text: André Ourednik

title: Add sparql as knit-engine to knitr package — eng_sparql
code: library(SPARQLchunks) knitr::knit_engines$set(sparql = SPARQLchunks::eng_sparql)

what: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a dataframe — sparql2df
title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a dataframe — sparql2df
text: Fetch data SPARQL endpoint store output dataframe

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a dataframe — sparql2df
code: sparql2df(endpoint, query, autoproxy = FALSE, auth = NULL)

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a dataframe — sparql2df
text: endpoint SPARQL endpoint (URL) query SPARQL query (character) autoproxy Try detect proxy automatically (boolean). Useful Windows machines behind corporate firewalls auth Authentication Information (httr-authenticate-object)

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a dataframe — sparql2df
text: SPARQL query result data.frame format

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a dataframe — sparql2df
code: library(SPARQLchunks) endpoint <- "https://lindas.admin.ch/query" query <- "PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>   SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . }" result_df <- sparql2df(endpoint, query) #> Preparing to send query to: https://lindas.admin.ch/query #> SPARQL string: #> PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/> #>   SELECT * WHERE { #>   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog . #>   ?subtype a schema:DataType . #> } #> Query URL: #> https://lindas.admin.ch/query?query=PREFIX%20schema%3A%20%3Chttp%3A%2F%2Fschema.org%2F%3E%0A%20%20SELECT%20%2A%20WHERE%20%7B%0A%20%20%3Fsub%20a%20schema%3ADataCatalog%20.%0A%20%20%3Fsubtype%20a%20schema%3ADataType%20.%0A%7D

what: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a list — sparql2list
title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a list — sparql2list
text: Fetch data SPARQL endpoint store output list

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a list — sparql2list
code: sparql2list(endpoint, query, autoproxy = FALSE, auth = NULL)

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a list — sparql2list
text: endpoint SPARQL endpoint (URL) query SPARQL query (character) autoproxy Try detect proxy automatically (boolean). Useful Windows machines behind corporate firewalls auth Authentication Information (httr-authenticate-object)

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a list — sparql2list
text: SPARQL query result form list

title: Fetch data from a SPARQL endpoint and store the output in a list — sparql2list
code: endpoint <- "https://lindas.admin.ch/query" query <- "PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/>   SELECT * WHERE {   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog .   ?subtype a schema:DataType . }" result_list <- sparql2list(endpoint, query) #> Preparing to send query to: https://lindas.admin.ch/query #> SPARQL string: #> PREFIX schema: <http://schema.org/> #>   SELECT * WHERE { #>   ?sub a schema:DataCatalog . #>   ?subtype a schema:DataType . #> } #> Query URL: #> https://lindas.admin.ch/query?query=PREFIX%20schema%3A%20%3Chttp%3A%2F%2Fschema.org%2F%3E%0A%20%20SELECT%20%2A%20WHERE%20%7B%0A%20%20%3Fsub%20a%20schema%3ADataCatalog%20.%0A%20%20%3Fsubtype%20a%20schema%3ADataType%20.%0A%7D #> Warning: Not Acceptable (HTTP 406). #> Warning: First query attempt result is empty. Trying without Accept=application/xml header. The result is not guaranteed to be a list.
